example: However, globalization changed the way people worked.
Many companies employed non-permanent employees, such as part-time workers and contract employees.
About 40 percent of Japanese workers are now non-permanent employees.
The way people start a business is also changing.
There are many different working styles now.
Companies also have a responsibility to employ disabled people.
Until recently, only workers with special skills could come from overseas and work in Japan.
The government says we need more ordinary workers.
We should have a fair and happy society, with good jobs for everyone.
